question:
Two trees have a combined height of 60 feet, and the taller tree is x times the height of the shorter tree. How tall is the shorter tree, in terms of x?
(A) \(\frac{60}{1+x}\)
(B) \(\frac{60}{x}\)
(C) \(\frac{30}{x}\)
(D) \(60 - 2x\)
(E) \(30 - 5x\)
Show
Hide
